biography: Scion of a craftsman's family. Apprenticed to Kristián Schröder (1655-1702), the curator of the Gallery at Prague Castle. He was influenced by the painters Johann Rudolf Bys, Abraham Godyn, and Michael Wenzel Halbax. Early works include Saint Mary Magdalene of 1693 (Mníšek pod Brdy, St. Wenceslas) and the Annunciation (housed in the Convent of Saint George, Prague). He specialized in large altar paintings, but made small portraits and genre scenes as well. He is among the most highly regarded Bohemian painters of the Baroque period (ULAN).
